title: Question:
author: BitcoinBarrel
content: And do you think anyone is named after a crypto today? Is there a kid out there named Doge? hehe

comments.author: salad daging
comments.body: I will never use a child's name with crypto even though I have a love of crypto, I will use a name that is more specific in my opinion but not about Cryptocurrency, but everyone is free to do it because of their love for something they believe in but there are some people who do that they think it's appropriate.I searched for articles and found a couple from Indonesia who gave their son Emeric Cardano out of love for the ADA coin and believed it was a long term investment when he had children he named the child "CARDANO"Article Source; https://www.cityam.com/crypto-crazy-couple-name-baby-after-favourite-digital-asset/

comments.author: Jemzx00
comments.body: Quote from: BitcoinBarrel on October 15, 2022, 03:08:37 PMDo you think anyone is named after a crypto today?Highly likely, I am 100% sure that there are already a lot of child out there that has been named after a cryptocurrencies especially with bitcoin. With how parents are naming their child nowadays, crypto-based names could be a quite common choice.Quote from: BitcoinBarrel on October 15, 2022, 03:08:37 PMIs there a kid out there named Doge? heheÂ  Based from this reddit post looks like there is someone named after dogecoin.Reddit: Got a little one on the way. If Doge reach $2 in 8months I will name my child Doge As for the topic, yes, I can imagine myself naming my child after a crypto as some of them are already based from the name of the creator of the token and some crypto out there has great name.

comments.author: Rruchi man
comments.body: I don't mean to sound superstitious but where I'm from we believe that names have power and have an influence on how our children will act so we always try to give our children very good names. Currently because of the very unpredictable nature of any cryptocurrency, I wouldn't consider giving my child a name after a cryptocurrency yet, I would not want my child exhibiting and unpredictable behavior. Say in the future when bitcoin has achieved stability, the name can be considered then but not currently.

comments.author: Wapfika
comments.body: There are quite some good names that can be used in crypto like Stellar, Casper, Nem and etc. It will depend on oir Surname if it will sound good but it is possible to use there are many good names now. It will be unique and can be remarkable to you if ever you hold such coin. Though there are some coinsnameÂ  that may not be appropriate like Doge to our childs name.

comments.author: Beefcake
comments.body: I would find an alt coin that no one ever heard of, and something that you wouldn't normally name a child. Like poochain for example. Excellent name.

comments.author: Hamza2424
comments.created_time: October 15, 2022, 04:14:34 PMLast edit: October 15, 2022, 07:25:51 PM by Hamza2424
comments.body: Nope and i think why anyone would like to do that as i can name my house after Crypto, Business too but how it makes sense to name the baby after crypto? I like BTC so I can name my pet after that but i think there too i need to think why I'm doing it am I a crazy fan, or just for fun and eventually, nobody cares?

comments.author: GiftedMAN
comments.body: Yes, I will love to name my first son after a crypto but I will like to make research about the particular crypto just to be sure that no one else has the name apart from the crypto and my son.Not yet a father though but I think seeing this post will give me a push to look for a unique name of crypto to name after my incoming son. In order ways, it's going to be something funny because most people from my region will likely want to know the meaning of the name of my son but is all good.

comments.author: piebeyb
comments.body: Previously I wanted to name bitcoin as the last name for my first one who is now 1 year old and I thought again it would be a bit difficult to use that nickname when he grew up, so I canceled my intention despite my high love for bitcoin, but I didn't had to do it, besides that one of my friends used the name of an altcoin project called IDENA for his daughter, because as long as the child was in the womb until delivery the cost was obtained from the mining of the project, he put the name IDENA in his daughter's last name

comments.author: ajiz138
comments.body: "John Ether" Maybe the name that will be on my mind someday if I have a son.Â  There's no philosophy but this leads to Ethereum.Names are very sacred so of course they will give the best names for their children, as for other crypto names that want to be folded in their love there are also those who don't want to use it.I myself have not thought about this too deeply but in my mind there is already a name, this needs my wife's approval in the future, so there are good names with crypto elements.

comments.author: Esther C
comments.body: No, I would never . I donâ€™t think thatâ€™s fair on them either. How would they feel when theyâ€™re old enough and they find out they were named a particular name for selfish reasons. Imagine calling your child EthereumðŸ˜…. Itâ€™s a No no for me.

comments.author: Esther C
comments.body: Quote from: Rruchi man on October 15, 2022, 03:31:27 PMI don't mean to sound superstitious but where I'm from we believe that names have power and have an influence on how our children will act so we always try to give our children very good names. Currently because of the very unpredictable nature of any cryptocurrency, I wouldn't consider giving my child a name after a cryptocurrency yet, I would not want my child exhibiting and unpredictable behavior. Say in the future when bitcoin has achieved stability, the name can be considered then but not currently.Hahaha. The unpredictable part got me laughing

comments.author: _BlackStar
comments.body: Quote from: BitcoinBarrel on October 15, 2022, 03:08:37 PMAnd do you think anyone is named after a crypto today?Someone might name their child after the cryptocurrency that made him rich so far, that's always possible for an increasingly crazy world.I'm interested to know how many people out there are starting to adopt the name satoshi nakamoto for their kids, it has become the coolest name for someone who really loves bitcoin. Honestly, I haven't thought about naming my son/ girl after any of the altcoin [let alone Dogecoin], LOL.

comments.author: defriadi
comments.body: no wonder about this, in various regions there must be using crypto names. would you give your child's name like that?? Hehehe

comments.author: aylabadia05
comments.body: Quote from: BitcoinBarrel on October 15, 2022, 03:08:37 PMAnd do you think anyone is named after a crypto today? Is there a kid out there named Doge? heheÂ  Hehe... interesting subject.Â Maybe out there someone gave the name of the child with the same name as crypto, but personally who already has children until now has not crossed my mind to give my child's name like one of the names of Crypto. Giving a name to children in my opinion must have meaning because the name is a parent's hope for children.

comments.author: kryptqnick
comments.body: Many coins have a 'coin' as a part of the name, which would be weird for a person. Also, regardless of the coin, it seems inappropriate to me to name a child after a currency, any currency. Associating a child with money like that just doesn't sit with me well. But if a crypto has a name that sounds well, it can coincidentally become a child's name, of course, and a fact that there's a coin shouldn't stop parents from choosing the word they like.I am surprised that 4 people voted 'yes' to the poll so far. I thought nobody would want to name children after currencies.

comments.author: bitzizzix
comments.body: I prefer names that have good meanings that will bring goodness when my child grows up, choosing a name for a child should not be arbitrary even though I idolize crypto and indeed there are lots of good crypto names to name children. But that doesn't mean I have to name my child after one of the good crypto names.and I thought of naming my child's last name with the addition of bitcoin's name, but I thought further and my wife didn't want to, finally I chose a name that had a good meaning for my future child.The reason I want to give my child a bitcoin last name is because my child's birth fees were all paid for in bitcoin, and it all happenedsuddenly, so that I will never forget it and it was a truly wonderful experience. And I share that story here https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5401052.0

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: No, I won't though I love crypto. Because I live in a country and belong to a religion, my name should suit accordingly. Rather I love to teach my kids about crypto which would help more. Keeping name matching with crypto just won't help them to learn it. Whether you name your kids similar crypto or not, give them a lesson about crypto to build their bright future.

comments.author: cheezcarls
comments.body: Although that I really love cryptocurrency since the day I've started my career, I don't think I would use crypto as a name for my future child. It's just my own instinct that I wouldn't use a crypto-related name to my future child's name. I'm just being curious about those people who have voted "YES" to name their child after a crypto. Hmm....

comments.author: RockBell
comments.body: Naming my child with any kind of crypto is kind of funny, even at the expense of loving crypto seen different individuals with crypto names is going to be actually funny imagine the registered name in school is ripple john, in school, the child will be made fun of because of such name and it will be of surprise to many individuals and might become a celebrity.
